Body: Ya Sin. 3943
The same is it to them whether thou admonish them or thou do not admonish them: they will not believe. 3950
Thou canst but admonish: such a one as follows the Message and fears the (Lord) Most Gracious unseen: give such a one therefore good tidings of Forgiveness and a Reward most generous. 3951 3952 3953
Verily We shall give life to the dead and We record that which they sent before and that which they leave behind and of all things have We taken account in a clear Book (of evidence). 3954 3955 3956
Set forth to them by way of a parable the (story of) the Companions of the City. Behold there came apostles to it. 3957
When We (first) sent to them two apostles they rejected them: but We strengthened them with a third: they said "Truly we have been sent on a mission to you." 3958
The (people) said: "Ye are only men like ourselves; and (Allah) Most Gracious sends no sort of revelation: Ye do nothing but lie." 3959 3960
They said: "Our Lord doth know that we have been sent on a mission to you: 3961
"And Our duty is only to proclaim the clear Message." 3962
The (people) said: "for us We augur an evil omen from you: if ye desist not we will certainly stone you and a grievous punishment indeed will be inflicted on you by us." 3963
They said: "Your evil omens are with yourselves: (deem ye this an evil omen) if ye are admonished? Nay but ye are a people transgressing all bounds!" 3964 3965
By the Qur'an full of Wisdom 3944
Then there came running from the farthest part of the City a man saying "O my people! obey the apostles: 3966
"Obey those who ask no reward of you (for themselves) and who have themselves received Guidance. 3967
"It would not be reasonable in me if I did not serve Him Who created me and to Whom ye shall (all) be brought back. 3968
"Shall I take (other) gods besides Him? If (Allah) Most Gracious should intend some adversity for me of no use whatever will be their intercession for me nor can they deliver me. 3969
"I would indeed if I were to do so be in manifest Error.
"For me I have faith in the Lord of you (all): listen then to me!" 3970
It was said: "Enter thou the Garden." He said "Ah me! would that my People knew (what I know)! 3971
"For that my Lord has granted me Forgiveness and has enrolled me among those held in honor!" 3972

And We sent not down against his People after Him any hosts from
			heaven nor was it needful for Us so to do.
It was no more than a single mighty Blast and behold! they were (like ashes) quenched and silent. 3973 3974
Thou art indeed one of the apostles.
Ah! alas for (My) servants! There comes not an apostle to them but they mock Him! 3975
See they not how many generations before them We destroyed? Not to them will they return: 3976

But each one of them all will be brought before Us (for
			judgment).
A Sign for them is the earth that is dead; We do give it life and produce grain therefrom of which ye do eat. 3977
And We produce therein orchards with date-palms and Vines and We cause springs to gush forth therein. 3978
That they may enjoy the fruits of this (artistry): it was not their hands that made this: will they not then give thanks? 3979 3980
Glory to Allah Who created in pairs all things that the earth produces as well as their own (human) kind and (other) things of which they have no knowledge. 3981
And a Sign for them is the Night: We withdraw therefrom the Day and behold they are plunged in darkness; 3982
And the Sun runs his course for a period determined for him: that is the decree of (Him) the exalted in Might the All-Knowing. 3983
And the Moon We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till she returns like the old (and withered) lower part of date-stalk. 3984 3985
On a Straight Way.
It is not permitted to the Sun to catch up the Moon nor can the Night outstrip the Day: each (just) swims along in (its own) orbit (according to Law). 3986 3987
And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the flood) in the loaded Ark; 3988
And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they ride. 3989
If it were Our Will We could drown them; then would there be no helper (to hear their cry) nor could they be delivered. 3990
Except by way of Mercy from Us and by way of (worldly) convenience (to serve them) for a time. 3991
When they are told "Fear ye that which is before you and that which will be after you in order that ye may receive Mercy" (they turn back). 3992
Not a Sign comes to them from among the Signs of their Lord but they turn away therefrom. 3993

And when they are told "Spend ye of (the bounties) with which Allah has provided you." You Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Shall we then feed those whom if Allah had so willed He would have fed (himself)? Ye are in nothing but manifest error." 3994 3995
Further they say "When will this promise (come to pass) if what ye say is true?" 3996

They will not (have to) wait for aught but a single Blast: it
			will seize them while they are yet disputing among themselves!
It is a Revelation sent down by (Him) the Exalted in Might Most Merciful. 3945

No (chance) will they then have by will to dispose (of their
			affairs) nor to return to their own people!
The trumpet shall be sounded when behold! from the sepulchers (men) will rush forth to their Lord! 3997
They will say: "Ah! woe unto us! Who hath raised us up from our beds of repose? (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah) Most Gracious had promised and true was the word of the apostles!" 3998
It will be no more than a single Blast when lo! they will all be brought up before Us! 3999
Then on that Day not a soul will be wronged in the least and ye shall but be repaid the meeds of your past Deeds. 4000
Verily the Companions of the Garden shall that Day have joy in all that they do; 4001
They and their associates will be in groves of (cool) shade reclining on thrones (of dignity); 4002
(Every) fruit (enjoyment) will be there for them; they shall have whatever they call for; 4003
"Peace! a Word (of salutation) from a Lord Most Merciful! 4004
And O ye in sin! get ye apart this Day! 4005
In order that thou mayest admonish a people whose fathers had received no admonition and who therefore remain heedless (of the Signs of Allah). 3946
"Did I not enjoin on you O ye children of Adam that ye should not worship Satan; for that he was to you an enemy avowed? 4006
"And that ye should worship Me (for that) this was the Straight Way? 4007
"But he did lead astray a great multitude of you. Did ye not then understand? 4008
"This is the Hell of which ye were (repeatedly) warned! 4009
"Embrace ye the (Fire) this Day for that ye (persistently) rejected (Truth)." 4010
That Day shall We set a seal on their mouths. But their hands will speak to Us and their feet bear witness to all that they did. 4011
If it had been Our Will We could surely have blotted out their eyes; then should they have run about groping for the Path but how could they have seen? 4012
And if it had been Our Will We could have transformed them (to remain) in their places: then should they have been unable to move about nor could they have returned (after error). 4013
If We grant long life to any We cause him to be reversed in nature: will they not then understand? 4014
We have not instructed the (Prophet) in Poetry nor is it meet for Him: this is no less than a Message and a Qur'an making things clear: 4015
The Word is proved true against the greater part of them; for they do not believe. 3947
That it may give admonition to any (who are) alive and that the charge may be proved against those who reject (Truth). 4016 4017
See they not that it is We Who have created for them among the things which Our hands have fashioned cattle which are under their dominion? 4018

And that We have subjected them to their (use)? Of them some do
			carry them and some they eat:
And they have (other) profits from them (besides) and they get (milk) to drink. Will they not then be grateful? 4019 4020

Yet they take (for worship) gods other than Allah (hoping) that
			they might be helped!
They have not the power to help them: but they will be brought up (before Our Judgment-Seat) as a troop (to be condemned). 4021
Let not their speech then grieve thee. Verily We know what they hide as well as what they disclose. 4022
Doth not man see that it is We Who created Him from sperm? Yet behold! He (stands forth) as an open adversary! 4023
And he makes comparisons for us and forgets his own (Origin and) Creation: He says "Who can give life to (dry) bones and decomposed ones (at that)?" 4024
Say "He will give them life Who created them for the first time! For He is well-versed in every kind of creation! 4025
We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins so that their heads are forced up (and they cannot see). 3948
"The same Who produces for you fire out of the green tree when behold! Ye kindle therewith (your own fires)! 4026
"Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like thereof?" Yea indeed! for He is the Creator Supreme of skill and knowledge (infinite)! 4027
Verily when He intends a thing His command is "Be" and it is! 4028
So glory to Him in Whose hands is the dominion of all things; and to Him will ye be all brought back. 4029
And We have put a bar in front of them and a bar behind them and further We have covered them up; so that they cannot see. 3949
